case_vignette: A 67-year-old-male farmer presents complaining of a growing mole on the right side of his cheek.   He states the mole was present for several years, but then started growing rapidly on one side a few weeks ago. Sometimes the mole will bleed on its own. He tries to avoid picking at the area.   Physical examination shows tan-brown ovoid irreuglarly shaped hyperpigmented macule with focal ulcearion. Dermoscopy demonstrates a blue-gray veil in the center of the lesion.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a mole on the right side of my cheek that has been growing quickly on one side for the past few weeks, and sometimes it bleeds on its own.
Final Diagnosis: Possible Malignant Melanoma. I need to confirm with a biopsy. Please make an appointment with a dermatologist as soon as possible.
